intro: Nigella sativa var. sativa, commonly known as black cumin, is an annual flowering plant native to South and Southwest Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark seeds and delicate yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with feathery, aromatic leaves. Its seeds are rich in essential oils, including thymoquinone, which is believed to have various medicinal properties. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a versatile crop in temperate climates.
